section.title: JAIN SLEE JMX Agent
section.para: The JMX Agent exposes all MBeans running in the server, including the ones mandated by the JAIN SLEE 1.1 specification.

important.para: The operations done through the JMX Agent are not kept once the server is shutdown. For instance, if a deployable unit is installed through JMX, and the server is shutdown, once the server is started again the deployable unit will not be installed.
By default, the JMX Agent listens to port 1099, and is only available at the host/ip which the server is bound.

section.title: JMX Console
section.para: &JEE.PLATFORM; provides a simple web console that gives quick access to all MBeans registred in the server, which includes the ones defined by the JAIN SLEE 1.1 specification.
To access the JMX console, with the server running, point a web browser to http://ip:8080/jmx-console, where ip is the IP/Host the container is bound, which is 127.0.0.1/localhost by default.

variablelist.para: MBeans in domain javax.slee are all standard JAIN SLEE 1.1 MBeans, while the ones in domain org.mobicents.slee are proprietary to &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE, the following ones are of particular interest:

listitem.para: the MBean which can be used to make non persistent changes to the server configuration, in runtime. The operation dumpContainerState displays a textual snapshot of the server's state, which can be used to quickly look for memory leaks or other debug/profiling related tasks.

the MBean allows interaction with the persistent deployable unit deployer. The operation showStatus displays a textual snapshot of the deployers's state, which can be used to quickly find out if there is any deployable unit deployment pending, for instance, due to missing dependencies.

important.para: For further information about JAIN SLEE 1.1 MBeans and their operations refer to the JAIN SLEE 1.1 Specification, all are covered with great detail.

section.title: &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Console
section.para: The JMX Console is simple but the MBeans operations were made considering its invocation by management clients, not people using browsers. &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; was developed to become Red Hat's Middleware Administration Tool, providing an unified interface and extensible model, to be used to control, monitor and manage servers individually, and clusters.
&THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE binary release includes a &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Console in tools/management-console, with standalone documentation.
